NOJIRA - Switch Travis CI to AMD64 Bionic Distro
body:
The Travis CI trusty image is deprecated. This change switches the distro to Bionic which builds against Ubuntu 18.

PS. I also experimented with arm-based builds which are super fast to startup (less than 10 seconds) but they are not as packed as others (No maven, Java installed, etc) and the cache seems somewhat suspicious with those. Bionic should do fine for now.

title: Check for presence of value before using an Optional
body:
This pull request:

- Removes a number of unused imports from Syncope
- Primarily makes sure, in certain areas, that Optional objects are checked to actually contain a value before a value can be retrieved. I specifically ran into an example of this, as a result of bad (manual) mapping configuration in the MasterContent.xml file, where no mapping was tagged with a `conn-object-key=1`. I decided to add a bit more safety to protect and defect against the dark arts...of dealing with optionals! :)

body: Allows an `AuditQuery` to pass along criteria for events and results, to be employed later on with Syncope's history management features.

title: SYNCOPE-1511: Provide Audit APIs
body:
This pull request demonstrates the basic outline of introduced components and the design, modeled and inspired by existing functionality/components in Syncope. This is still very much a WIP and will be updated continuously.

A brief outline of the changes are:

1. AuditService as the main REST API interface, presenting search ops
2. AuditLogic in charge of executing search ops, etc.
3. AuditDAO and AuditDataBinder, in charge of handling the JPA layer and data bindings.
4. AuditTO, AuditEntry and AuditEntryImpl as carrier/transfer objects between the data layer, core and APIs.

title: [SYNCOPE-1502]: find anytos using FIQL
body:
PR contains improvements when AnyTOs are searched using FIQL queries:

- AnyTO objects are searched by keys retrieved from the search view using a single SQL query that contains IN condition
-  replacement of multiple OR-realm condition in the resulted SQL query that is executed to search entities in search views with IN clause.

title: NOJIRA: Enable Apache Maven wrapper plugin
body:
This pull request enables the [maven-wrapper for Syncope](https://github.com/takari/maven-wrapper). Main objectives are:

1. Local builds do not need to have (the right version of ) Apache Maven locally installed; specially relevant for Windows.
2. Control the build via the proper Apache Maven version. 

The command to update the wrapper would be: `mvn -N io.takari:maven:0.7.6:wrapper` (or whatever is the version of the plugin)

Notes:

> By default, the Maven Wrapper JAR archive is added to the using project as small binary file .mvn/wrapper/maven-wrapper.jar. It is used to bootstrap the download and invocation of Maven from the wrapper shell scripts. If your project is not allowed to contain binary files like this, you can configure your version control system to exclude checkin/commit of the wrapper jar.

> If the JAR is not found to be available by the scripts they will attempt to download the file from the URL specified in .mvn/wrapper/maven-wrapper.properties under wrapperUrl and put it in place. The download is attempted via curl, wget and, as last resort, by compiling the ./mvn/wrapper/MavenWrapperDownloader.java file and executing the resulting class.

title: NOJIRA: Protect invocations against NPEs and illegal sort ops
body:
This pull request is a semi-large cleanup effort to protect against the following issues:

- Immutable object modification as part of sort operations.
- Null check clean up where the condition is always true/false
- Protect against NPEs where objects may be calculated as `null`
- Switch sort ops to use factory methods such as `List.sort()` instead of `Collections.sort()`

All FITs should pass, as they did locally.

title: NOJIRA: Update opensaml dependency w/ minor clean up
body:
- Update OpenSAML dependency to the latest available version, 3.4.4
- Add relevant repositories to locate and resolve artifacts
- Remove unused class (which can in fact be turned into a default interface method if necessary)
- Scanned for usages of deprecated content in the new OpenSAML version; none were found.

title: NOJIRA: Clean up SpringBoot set up and @Bean methods
body:
This pull request does a modest amount of cleaning up Spring Boot configuration and/or bean methods

- Marks a number of bean methods as conditional so they can be overridden by deployers without overlaying the whole class, etc.
- Merges relevant Spring Boot annotations together
- Allows bean methods to be named by their respective method names to keep things consistent across the codebase.

title: NOJIRA: Update Oracle db client dependency coordinates; increase timeouts
body:
- The Oracle database client is now available in Maven Central. This pull request updates the coordinates.
- Docker-based tests for Oracle are switched to use Oracle enterprise edition 12g (the slim variant of the image)
- Timeouts are increased to account for updates and startup time.

title: NOJIRA - Small improvements/changes from static analysis reports
body:
This pull request is quite large, but it is also largely innocent. It presents the following:

- Remove toString() calls on arrays
- Make sure collected collections as return values are used
- Replace String literals of length one being used in concatenation, gaining some performance enhancement.
- Mark relevant methods (private or final) as static where appropriate, gaining small performance enhancement.
- Add RAT checks to CI independently, removing them from the verify phase for FITs.

title: SYNCOPE-1489: Reorganize travis CI into build stages/jobs
body:
This is the initial step at changing travis CI to run under multiple stages and jobs. This *first pass* creates a very basic build that also verifies Javadocs and Checkstyle, etc. Follow PRs will modify the CI to include tests and FITs, etc. As part of this PR, issues related to Javadoc failures are fixed that affect improper tag usage.

There is a small thing with the checkstyle job that needs to be worked out, but this is good enough for now and for reviews.

title: SYNCOPE-1332: Java 11 language features; use factory calls for immutable collections
body:
See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SYNCOPE-1332

> Java 9 came with static methods on the List, Set and Map interfaces for creating unmodifiable instances of those collections. Till now, to create immutable collection, programmers had to construct it, store it in a local variable, fill with add method and wrap into a unmodifiable collection.

There are many other references to unmodifiableList, unmodifiableSet, etc. However the conversion isn't quite straight forward to begin with, and due to API incompatibility, the inner collection must turn into an array before it be wrapped in a factory call.

Example:

```
return Collections.unmodifiableSet(values);
```

Which could turn into:

```
return Set.of(values.toArray(new Object[] {}));
```

Not sure if there is any value in covering those, so I skipped them for now.

SYNCOPE-1448 add synchronized block for bean loading/register section
body:
Issue [SYNCOPE-1448](https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/SYNCOPE/issues/SYNCOPE-1448)

When two threads (T1,T2) arrive the section `if (ApplicationContextProvider.getBeanFactory().containsSingleton(ruleClass.getName())) {`at the same time they will both assume that there is no bean, which is right so far.

T1 register the bean as it should here `ApplicationContextProvider.getBeanFactory().registerSingleton(ruleClass.getName(), rule);`. As soon as T2does the same, an exception is thrown. 

Solution:

When T1 and T2 found that a given bean is not there, they'll hit a synchronized section with double checking. This will prevent the duplicated creation and registration of a bean.
